author: @Wang Zhan
title: An exceptionally hot July for Hong Kong
text: HONG KONG ‚Äì With a stronger-than-usual subtropical ridge dominating over southern China for most of the time last month, July was exceptionally hot, according to the [Hong Kong Observatory](https://www.chinadailyhk.com/hk/article/588689#HKO-issues-hot-weather-alert-after-cancelling-all-typhoon-signals-2024-07-22). The monthly mean minimum temperature of 28 degrees Celsius, monthly mean temperature of 29.9 degrees and monthly mean maximum temperature of 32.4 degrees were respectively 1.1, 1 and 0.8 degrees above their normal figures, the forecaster said in its [monthly weather summary](https://www.hko.gov.hk/en/wxinfo/pastwx/mws2024/mws202407.htm) on Friday. For the month of July, the three monthly figures were respectively one of the third, the fourth and one of the ninth highest on record. READ MORE: [HK sizzles at 34.4¬∞C as very hot weather persists for 8th day](https://www.chinadailyhk.com/hk/article/586720#HK-sizzles-at-34.4%C2%B0C-as-very-hot-weather-persists-for-8th-day-2024-06-27) ‚ÄúThe daily mean temperature of 30.8 degrees and daily minimum temperature of 29.2 degrees on July 6 were both the highest on record for Moderate Heat,‚Äù said the HKO, adding that the daily maximum temperature of 34 degrees on the same day was also one of the highest on record for Moderate Heat. With plenty of sunshine, the temperature at the HKO rose to a maximum of 34.8 degrees on the afternoon of July 7, the highest of the month. ‚ÄúIt was extremely hot on the afternoons of 7 and 10 July with maximum temperatures reaching 35 degrees or above in many places.‚Äù The monthly rainfall meanwhile was 458.5 millimeters, about 19 percent above the normal of 385.8 mm. ALSO READ: [April heat breaks Hong Kong‚Äôs 140-year record](https://www.chinadailyasia.com/hk/article/582358#April-heat-breaks-Hong-Kong%E2%80%99s-140-year-record-2024-05-03) ‚ÄúThe accumulated rainfall recorded in the first seven months of the year was 1 321.9 mm, about 10 percent below the normal figure of 1 468.2 mm for the same period,‚Äù said the HKO. Three tropical cyclones occurred over the South China Sea and the western North Pacific in July, the observatory added.

author: Syndicated Content
title: Nicaragua arrests two high-ranking Catholic priests with close ties to cardinal
text:
By Ismael Lopez
SAN JOSE (Reuters) ‚Äì Nicaraguan police detained on Thursday two senior Catholic priests who are close to the country‚Äôs top church leader, a person with knowledge of the matter said, raising to at least six the number of clergymen detained this week.
The source, who declined to be named for fear of arrest, said the two priests were detained for publicly praying for jailed Bishop Rolando Alvarez, the most prominent critic of President Daniel Ortega.
Local media outlet Confidencial named the priests as Carlos Aviles and Hector Treminio, and noted that their arrest brings to at least six the number of priests detained over the past week, adding that two of the clerics had already been released.
The government‚Äôs press office did not immediately respond to a request for comment.
Over the past few years, Ortega‚Äôs government has targeted members of the Catholic church, a crackdown officials have in the past said was needed to punish treasonous behavior or other alleged crimes.
Aviles is the second-highest ranking cleric in the Archdiocese of Managua, led by Cardinal Leopoldo Brenes, while Treminio is its treasurer.
Alvarez, the bishop of Matagalpa, forcefully criticized the government‚Äôs deadly response to mass protests that broke out in 2018, and was convicted of treason and sentenced to a 26-year prison term earlier this year.
Last week, police arrested Bishop Isidro Mora of the Siuna diocese, making him the second bishop to be detained after Alvarez‚Äôs detention in 2022.
Many of the latest clergymen detained were arrested because they publicly offered prayers for Alvarez, according to the source and local media, but the government has not issued any statements explaining the priests‚Äô alleged crimes.
Nicaraguan Bishop Silvio Baez, who has been living in exile in Florida since 2019 and is the second-ranking leader of the archdiocese, called for the priests to be released.
‚ÄúI ask God to protect them and that they be freed immediately!‚Äù wrote in a post on X on Thursday.
According to exiled Nicaraguan researcher Martha Patricia Molina, who publishes records of what she describes as the persecution of the Catholic Church under Ortega, the number of bishops, priests and seminarians behind bars in the country currently stands at nine.
(Reporting by Ismael Lopez; Writing by David Alire Garcia and Miral Fahmy)

author: Laura French
title: RansomHub affiliates scramble amid apparent internal conflict
text:
most prolific ransomware groupof 2024 following the disruption of LockBit and ALPHV/BlackCat, apparently faced ‚Äúa series of internal disagreements and disunity‚Äù at the beginning of April,
GuidePoint‚Äôs Research and Intelligence Team (GRIT) reportedon Tuesday.An ‚Äúunknown number of affiliates‚Äù were cut off from RansomHub‚Äôs communication channels with victims on April 1 due to the internal conflict, leading the cybercriminals to move negotiations to other channels, including the platforms of other RaaS groups, according to GRIT.Meanwhile, some members aired their confusion on the dark web cybercrime forum RAMP, where a rival ransomware group called DragonForce claimed that RansomHub had partnered with them and migrated their infrastructure. GuidePoint noted that DragonForce may simply be taking the opportunity to muddy the waters and market themselves amid the turmoil, although DragonForce did take over another RaaS operation called BlackLock last month after its
data leak site was compromisedby Resecurity researchers.‚ÄúThis incident can bring to light the notion that there really is ‚Äòno honor among thieves,‚Äô‚Äù noted GuidePoint Security Principal Threat Intelligence Consultant Justin Timothy, in an email to SC Media.Supporting the theory that RansomHub is facing setbacks due to internal conflict is the fact that the group‚Äôs data leak site has been inactive since March 31.‚ÄúIt is not entirely unusual for data leak sites to experience short durations of downtime due to hosting instabilities associated with the dark web, however this downtime coupled with the internal strife that we are seeing from RansomHub could be further indication of the group‚Äôs internal administration deteriorating,‚Äù Timothy said.Ironically, RansomHub gained much of its success and notoriety through recruiting disgruntled affiliates from other groups like ALPHV/BlackCat, which reportedly
pulled an exit scamon its own affiliates when it dismantled last year. Most notably, RansomHub recruited the threat actor known as ‚Äúnotchy‚Äù to
obtain data from the Change Healthcare breachafter ALPHV/BlackCat allegedly ran with a $22 million ransom.Additionally, RansomHub has marketed its affiliate program by offering favorable revenue cuts and allowing ransom payments to go directly to affiliates, presenting itself as a more trustworthy and affiliate-friendly RaaS group, GRIT noted.‚ÄúWhile information continues to emerge, we cannot help but note the irony of a group which rose to prominence by promising stability and security for affiliates appearing to have failed or betrayed those same affiliates within a year,‚Äù the GRIT researchers wrote.As the situation unfolds, RansomHub victims also face confusion as they are suddenly directed to new communication channels by threat actors. Timothy said organizations that fall victim to ransomware should have second thoughts about negotiating with these groups.‚ÄúBecause of this, responders themselves may have even less trust in RaaS operations if a ransom payment is made and a decryptor/data deletion is promised. These events highlight that the ransomware actors are criminals at the end of the day and inherently untrustworthy,‚Äù Timothy said.

author: BOL
title: EUA sanciona executivo de companhia a√©rea por facilitar migra√ß√£o irregular - Not√≠cias - BOL
text:
EUA sanciona executivo de companhia a√©rea por facilitar migra√ß√£o irregular 13/06/2024 18h35
O governo do presidente Joe Biden "est√° tomando medidas para impor restri√ß√µes de visto a um executivo" de uma companhia a√©rea de voos fretados por "facilitar a migra√ß√£o irregular aos Estados Unidos atrav√©s da Nicar√°gua", informou o Departamento de Estado em um comunicado.
O texto n√£o cita o nome do executivo sancionado, nem o da companhia a√©rea, mas explica que os voos para a Nicar√°gua s√£o feitos de fora do continente americano.
"Ningu√©m deve se beneficiar dos migrantes vulner√°veis, nem os traficantes de pessoas, nem as empresas privadas, nem os funcion√°rios p√∫blicos", insistiu o porta-voz do Departamento de Estado, Matthew Miller, no comunicado.
"Continuaremos tomando medidas para impor restri√ß√µes de visto aos propriet√°rios, executivos e funcion√°rios do alto escal√£o de empresas de transporte sem escr√∫pulos", acrescentou.
Em meados de maio, os Estados Unidos impuseram san√ß√µes √† Nicar√°gua, acusando o pa√≠s de lucrar com a migra√ß√£o, e emitiram um alerta para advertir as companhias a√©reas a evitar serem c√∫mplices "na explora√ß√£o de migrantes".
Essas san√ß√µes fazem parte de uma pol√≠tica promovida por Washington desde fevereiro passado para sancionar diretores de empresas de transporte terrestre, mar√≠timo ou a√©reo que promovem a migra√ß√£o irregular.
A aflu√™ncia de migrantes √© um dos temas que mais preocupam os eleitores americanos a poucos meses das elei√ß√µes presidenciais de novembro, que ser√£o disputadas pelo democrata Joe Biden, candidato √† reelei√ß√£o, e pelo republicano Donald Trump.
A patrulha fronteiri√ßa dos Estados Unidos realizou em abril mais de 179 mil intercepta√ß√µes de migrantes e solicitantes de asilo, em sua maioria latino-americanos, que cruzaram ilegalmente a fronteira com o M√©xico, segundo dados oficiais.

author: Andr√© Nicolau
title: Fortes chuvas formam lagos no Deserto do Saara e imagens s√£o simplesmente deslumbrantes
text:
Chuvas fortes no Saara: Em Tagounite, vilarejo no sudeste do Marrocos, ca√≠ram impressionantes 100 mil√≠metros de chuva em apenas 24 horas, ap√≥s seis anos de seca implac√°vel ‚Äì reprodu√ß√£o/imagebrokermicrostock - reprodu√ß√£o/imagebrokermicrostock
Ap√≥s semanas de intensas tempestades, o Deserto do Saara, um dos ambientes mais √°ridos do planeta, testemunhou um cen√°rio quase surreal: inunda√ß√µes inesperadas causadas por chuvas que chegaram a mais 100 mil√≠metros, em apenas 24 horas, no sudeste do Marrocos .
As precipita√ß√µes, que h√° d√©cadas n√£o visitavam essa imensid√£o de dunas e palmeiras, transformaram trechos do deserto em verdadeiros o√°sis tempor√°rios.
Normalmente imune √†s chuvas durante o ver√£o, o Saara foi surpreendido por uma tempestade extratropical , fen√¥meno raro que promete alterar o clima da regi√£o nos pr√≥ximos meses.
Com uma m√©dia anual de menos de 250 mil√≠metros de chuva ‚Äì e em alguns locais, n√£o mais que uma dezena ‚Äì, o deserto viu essa marca ser superada em poucos dias.
üö® MUDAN√áAS CLIM√ÅTICAS üö®
üåßÔ∏è CHUVAS NO SAARA üåßÔ∏è
Est√° tudo normal, garantem os negacionistas.
Essas s√£o imagens do Marrocos depois de chuvas hist√≥ricas.
Ao mesmo tempo em que o Saara recebe chuva in√©dita, a Floresta Amaz√¥nica seca e a Ant√°rtida ganha camada verde. üò≥ pic.twitter.com/KdQWmS39eH
‚Äî Bruno Brezenski (@bbbrezenski) October 9, 2024
Impactos das fortes chuvas no Deserto do Saara As autoridades marroquinas, que j√° enfrentavam dificuldades com o racionamento de √°gua, agora esperam que essas chuvas ajudem a reabastecer os preciosos reservat√≥rios que sustentam as comunidades da regi√£o.
Contudo, mesmo com a recarga dos aqu√≠feros subterr√¢neos, o impacto das chuvas sobre a seca permanece incerto.Isso porque, embora as tempestades sejam revigorantes para o solo, elas tamb√©m deixaram um rastro de destrui√ß√£o, vitimando ao menos 20 pessoas no Marrocos e na Arg√©lia, al√©m de danos √†s estradas, redes el√©tricas e ao sistema de distribui√ß√£o de √°gua pot√°vel.
Curiosamente, a Nasa j√° havia detectado sinais de aumento da umidade e at√© mesmo de vegeta√ß√£o no Saara no final do m√™s passado, evidenciando como essas chuvas an√¥malas est√£o temporariamente revivendo a paisagem des√©rtica.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: ACC Fans All Had The Same Four-Word Message For SMU After Boston College Beatdown
text: No. 17 SMU (11-2) entered today's Wasabi Fenway Bowl as a double-digit favorite over unranked Boston College (6-6). But after a battle in the pouring rain, the Mustangs left Fenway Park with a postseason loss and a 14-23 final score in favor of the Eagles. SMU accepted an invitation to join the ACC earlier this year. While the Mustangs' participation in the conference doesn't begin until 2024, today was a little taste of what the program can expect moving forward. Everyone had the same message for SMU after today's nine-point upset loss. "Welcome to the ACC." "Welcome to the ACC, enjoy your brief time here," one fan wrote. "Y‚Äôall got baptized by BC. Welcome to the ACC," another said. "SMU losing to a 6-6 BC team. Welcome to the ACC," another added. SMU finished its 2023 season with nine straight victories, including an American Athletic Conference Championship win over No. 22 Tulane. While the program was able to take care of business in the AAC this past season, it appears they may have a bit more trouble when they join the ACC next year.
